channel.title: Computer Build Questions
channel.description:
I put this list together and want to know how it is for my first build? [url=http://pcpartpicker.com/p/Tmaa]http://pcpartpicker.com/p/Tmaa[/url]
Note - I am planning to put windows 7 on the SSD. Thanks!

item.title: Computer Build Questions
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Ty for the info, I’ll be sure to get one when I get a new PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Build Questions
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Out of curiosity is using SSDs noticably better than normal SATA or w.e. it's called HDDs?
Yeah I got my first SSD a few days ago and the speed improvements are crazy. You're going to still want to get a normal HDD to run with it though to store a lot of your stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Build Questions
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

SATA is an interface for the drives and the mother board.

As for SSD, not only are they much faster then a hard drive, they’re also more efficient with power and also can withstand a higher stock rating. So if you drop your laptop or desktop say from your desk you shouldn’t need to worry as much about the hard drive smashing to a pile of scrap. Some other massive improvements are PCI SSD’s which can get even higher ratings than a SATA drive.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Build Questions
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

@nick, I know what a SSD is and what a SSD can do… sigh

[quote=“Travas, post:7, topic:518049”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=636312.msg4290470#msg4290470 date=1367126378]
Out of curiosity is using SSDs noticably better than normal SATA or w.e. it’s called HDDs?
[/quote]Indeed. Look up benchmarks for them, you’d be surprised how much a difference it is. The only downside is the cost.[/quote]
I see, indeed

item.title: Computer Build Questions
item.dc:creator: @nickog15 nickog15
item.description:
@nickog15 wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:2, topic:518049”]You sure that case will suffice your needs?

I would had also spent another 50-75$ to get a better processor just for those multi tasking days[/quote]

What do you mean about the case?

Lin:

Outstanding build for the price. Stick with the AMD processor.

Thanks!

Kidpaparoach:

Out of curiosity is using SSDs noticably better than normal SATA or w.e. it’s called HDDs?

If you put your OS on there it then it will run faster, and there is no moving parts so faster and no noise.

Read full topic

item.description:

I’d splurge a bit if I were you and just get an Intel CPU. Also, I’d recommend http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820721107 instead of the one you’re getting.
